page.title: 01Hills & Dales, Staintondale
page.content: This block is within the North Yorkshire Moors National Park which is renownes for its scenic beauty. Mainly grassland and some arable farmland, natural mixed woodland and conifer plantations. Hills and dales and coastal cliffs. Streams running to the sea through wooded ravines. Usual wildlife plus badgers and roe deer. The people who live and work here are mostly farmers. One farm open to the public as country museum, also shire horses, harness & working implements. Some farms take holidaymakers as paying guests. Hounds of Staintondale Hunt kept in village. Part of "Cleveland Way" long distance footpath follows coastline. Scenic footpath created from track of old railway. The spectacular views attract summer visitors but otherwise a quiet and close knit community.
